data.title: Dwight Powell - Men's Basketball 2013-14
data.meta_description: Men's Basketball 2013-14 - Dwight Powell: The Official Athletic Site of Stanford University, partner of WMT Digital. The most comprehensive coverage of Stanford Athletics with rosters, schedules, scores, highlights, game recaps, and more!
data.text:
FEATURES: Toronto Globe and Mail (3/26/14) | SI.com (3/26/14) | Bay Area News Group (3/25/14) | www.gostanford.com (11/5/13) | www.gostanford.com (2/12/13) | San Francisco Chronicle (1/12/13) | Associated Press (12/12/12) | www.gostanford.com (2/28/12) | Rivals.com (10/22/10)

As a Senior (2013)

All-Pac-12 First Team honoree ... NCAA All-South Regional Team selection ... Pac-12 Scholar-Athlete of the Year ... Pac-12 All-Academic Honorable Mention pick ... Preseason Wooden Award candidate ... Senior CLASS Award candidate ... started all 36 games ... averaged 14.0 points and 6.9 rebounds ... shot 46.2 percent ... led team in assists (112) and steals (47) ... dished out at least five assists in game 11 times ... notched five 20-point games ... scored in double figures 28 times ... notched double-double with 17 points and 12 rebounds while dishing out six assists against Bucknell (Nov. 8) ... scored 28 points (10-15 FG) against BYU (Nov. 11) ... scored 20 points (8-16 FG) against Houston (Nov. 25) ... totaled 20 points (7-12 FG, 6-9 FT) with nine rebounds and six assists against Pittsburgh (Nov. 26) ... posted double-double with 15 points and 10 rebounds versus UC Davis (Dec. 14) ... tallied double-double of 10 points and season-high 15 rebounds against Connecticut (Dec. 18) ... tallied double-double with 13 points and 10 rebounds against Oregon State (Jan. 9) ... against Oregon (Jan. 12), totaled 14 points and six assists ... posted double-double of 17 points and 10 rebounds against Washington (Jan. 18) ... recorded double-double of 17 points and 13 boards against UCLA (Jan. 23) ... added 14 points, six rebounds, four assists and three steals at USC (Jan. 26) ... matched season high with 28 points (8-19 FG, 10-12 FT) against Arizona State (Feb. 1) ... tallied double-double of 22 points (11-14 FT) and 11 rebounds at California (Feb. 5) ... Added 15 points and seven rebounds in win over Kansas (Mar. 23) ... tallied 17 points and nine rebounds against Dayton (Mar. 27).

As a Junior (2012)

NABC All-District Second Team selection ... Pac-12 Most Improved Player of the Year ... All-Pac-12 First Team honoree ... Pac-12 All-Academic Second Team recipient ... NABC Honors Court selection ... one of two players to start all 34 games ... averaged team-best 14.9 points to go with 8.4 rebounds ... shot 46.7 percent (179-383) overall, 45.5 percent (15-33) from three-point range and 79.6 percent (133-167) from the foul line ... 10 double-doubles ... registered nine 20-point games ... produced 27 double-figure scoring games ... led team in scoring 13 times ... scored at least 15 points during the second half of a game on six occasions ... one of two players ranked among Pac-12's top-12 in both scoring (11th) and rebounding (7th) ... totaled 72 assists, 39 blocks and 26 steals ... 16-17 from foul line in game's final two minutes ... poured in 27 points against San Francisco (Nov. 9) ... finished with 14 points and 12 rebounds against CS Fullerton (Nov. 12) ... contributed 18 points and 10 boards against Missouri (Nov. 22) ... scored 22 points (7-11 FG, 7-7 FT) against Min-nesota (Nov. 24) ... hauled down 13 rebounds against Seattle (Nov. 28) ... scored career-high 29 points (10-13 FG, 9-11 FT) against Denver (Dec. 2) ... poured in 23 points at NC State (Dec. 18) ... added 17 points and 13 rebounds at UCLA (Jan. 5) ... notched 16 points and 11 rebounds against Washington State (Jan. 9) ... finished with 12 points, 13 rebounds and three steals against Oregon (Jan. 30) ... poured in 24 points (10-11 FT) and grabbed 10 boards at Arizona (Feb. 6) ... produced 22 points and 10 rebounds at Arizona State (Feb. 9) ... collected double-double with 17 points and career-high 17 rebounds against USC (Feb. 14) ... scored 22 points in loss to UCLA (Feb. 16) ... notched double-double with 20 points and 11 rebounds at Oregon State (Feb. 21) ... tallied 23 points (11-18 FG), nine rebounds and four assists versus Arizona State (Mar. 13) ... chalked up 10th double-double, totaling 12 points and 15 rebounds against Stephen F. Austin (Mar. 19).

As a Sophomore (2011)

Pac-12 All-Academic Honorable Mention pick ... during five-game NIT title run, averaged 8.8 points and 5.8 rebounds per game while shooting 65.4 percent from the field ... played in 35 games, making 11 starts ... averaged 5.8 points and 4.6 rebounds per game ... shot 45.3 percent from the field ... scored in double figures six times ... led team in rebounding eight times ... 55-78 from the foul line, good for 70.5 percent ... third on team with 28 steals ... in season debut after missing first two games with an ankle sprain, scored 13 points in 17 minutes at UC Davis (Nov. 18) ... against Oregon State (Jan. 7), posted a double-double with 10 points and 11 rebounds in 38 minutes ... contributed nine points, nine boards and was 5-5 from the free throw line in a win over Oregon State (Feb. 16) ... poured in a season-high 18 points on 8-11 shooting to go with nine rebounds against Illinois State (Mar. 19) ... added seven points and five rebounds against Minnesota (Mar. 29).

As a Freshman (2010)

Pac-10 All-Freshman Team honoree ... played in 31 games, making 26 starts ... 26 starts ranked third-most all-time among Stanford freshmen ... averaged 8.1 points and 5.2 rebounds per game ... shot 47.1 percent from the field and 68.3 percent from the foul line ... scored in double-figures 11 times ... led team in rebounding 11 times ... knocked down a pair of free throws against San Diego (Nov. 15) for his first career points ... added 13 points (9-9 free throws) and 10 boards against DePaul (Nov. 28) for his first career double-double ... chipped in with 20 points and seven boards against California (Jan. 2) ... added 16 points and eight boards against Washington State (Feb. 11) ... posted his second double-double with 11 points and 11 boards against Oregon (Feb. 26).

World University Games

Led Canada to a fourth-place finish at the World University Games in Kazan, Russia, in July 2013 ... in addition to starting seven of Canada's eight contests, averaged 12.1 points and 5.1 rebounds per game while shooting 61.9 percent (39-63) from the field and playing just under 18 minutes per game ... just before the World University Games, anchored Canada to a sweep of the Four Nations' International Invitational Tournament played in three different cities in China ... 11-day competition saw Canada finish with a 9-0 record while registering three victories apiece against United States, Latvia and China.

High School

2010 graduate of IMG Academy in Bradenton, Fla. ... ranked by Rivals.com as No. 7 among power forwards, No. 23 overall and rated as a five-star prospect ... ranked as a top-five center in the 2010 class by ESPNU ... averaged 23.2 points, 11.6 rebounds, 4.4 assists and 2.3 blocks per game as a senior ... originally from Toronto, made the move from Canada to Bradenton, Fla., where he prepped at IMG Academy the past three years ... during the summer of 2009, was one of two high school players invited to train with the Canadian National Team ... member of the National All-Stars roster during the second annual High School Academic All-American Classic ... at the same event, earned recogni-tion as the Academic Player of the Year ... named MVP and Scholar-Athlete of the Year for the IMG Basketball Academy ... selected to the Amare Stoudemire Skills Academy and LeBron James Skills Academy while playing in the adidas Nations Tournament with his AAU team, Grassroots Canada.
